NDEFRecord.summary: NOTE Experimental The NDEFRecord interface of the Web NFC API provides data that can be read from, or written to, compatible NFC devices, e.g., NFC tags supporting NDEF.

NDEFRecordEncoding.summary:
NOTE Experimental The encoding
property of the interface returns the encoding of
a textual payload, or null otherwise.
NDEFRecordEncoding.value:
A string which can be one of the following: "utf-8",
"utf-16", "utf-16le", or "utf-16be".

NDEFRecordRecordType.summary:
NOTE Experimental The recordType
property of the interface returns the record type of the record.
NDEFRecordRecordType.value: A string which can be one of the following:

NDEFRecordToRecords.summary:
NOTE Experimental The toRecords()
method of the interface converts
to a sequence of records based on
, and returns the result. This allows
parsing the payloads of record types which may contain nested records, such
as smart poster and external type records.

NDEFRecordNDEFRecord.summary:
NOTE Experimental The NDEFRecord()
constructor of the Web NFC API returns a
newly constructed object that represents data that can be
read from, or written to, compatible NFC devices; e.g., NFC tags supporting NDEF.

NDEFRecordData.summary:
NOTE Experimental The data
property of the interface returns a
containing the raw bytes of the record's payload.
NDEFRecordData.value: A that contains encoded payload data of the record.

NDEFRecordLang.summary:
NOTE Experimental The lang
property of the interface returns the language of
a textual payload, or null if one was not supplied.

remarks.para:
The record might be missing a language tag, for example, if the recorded information is
not locale-specific.

-HTML lang attribute, that declares content language of the document or its elements
-HTTP headers that declare content language: Content-Language and Accept-Language

NDEFRecordMediaType.summary:
NOTE Experimental The mediaType
property of the interface returns the {{Glossary("MIME type")}} of the record. This value will be null if recordType is not equal to "mime".
NDEFRecordMediaType.value:
A string, containing the MIME type of the record
payload.

NDEFRecordId.summary:
NOTE Experimental The id property of the
interface returns the record identifier, which is an
absolute or relative URL used to identify the record.

remarks.para:
This identifier is created by the generator of the record which is solely responsible
for enforcing record identifier uniqueness. Web NFC does not sign the NFC content, thus
record consumer should not make any assumptions about integrity or authenticity of the
identifier or any other part of the records.
